text:
It's officially New York Fashion Week, the first — and generally most star-studded — in the fashion week calendar.



But what are this season's talking points? We've rounded up everything you need to know about NYFW Spring/Summer 2016...



Victoria Beckham's show



Make sure you're on Instagram at 3pm on Sunday – Victoria Beckham is bound to spark a social media frenzy when she debuts her latest offerings.

Victoria Beckham's famous family support her from the front row





The front row seats of her show are normally occupied by her famous family members and last season saw husband David, sons Brooklyn, Romeo and Cruz and little daughter Harper cheering Victoria on.



Givenchy's New York debut



To celebrate the opening of their Madison Square store, Givenchy has moved their show from Paris to New York.



Given the brand's penchant for top models and famous front row-ers (think Katy Perry, Rihanna and Kim Kardashian), it's likely to be a big talking point.



Caitlyn Jenner for Givenchy?



It's been rumoured that Caitlyn Jenner will walk the runway at the Givenchy for Riccardo Tisci show.

The Givenchy show is likely to feature some of the Kardashian-Jenner clan





Nothing has been confirmed, but if the transgender star doesn't end up making her catwalk debut for the brand, it's likely that she, along with her family members, will attend the show – stepdaughter Kim Kardashian and her husband Kanye West are good friends with designer Riccardo.



The Fat Jewish



Joshua Ostrovsky, famously known on Instagram as The Fat Jewish, made waves in the fashion world when he revealed that he would be showing his debut collection at NYFW.



If you're familiar with his Instagram account, you'll know his show is definitely something to watch out for...



Marc Jacobs' 'DRESS TO KILL' code



Marc Jacobs has struck fear in the hearts of party-goers by issuing a strict dress code for his NYFW party. An 88-word document in all caps reveals demands that include " FUR COATS OVER LINGERIE, LIP GLOSS, JERRY HALL SIDE-SWEPT HAIR, SEQUINS, SKY HIGH STILETTOS, MIRRORED AVIATORS, METAL MESH, COWL NECKLINE HALTERS, GLOSS-Y SKIN, SLITS, SHEER HAREM PANTS". Eek.



Lauren Conrad will debut her collection



As huge The Hills fans, we're beyond happy for Lauren Conrad, who will be showing at New York Fashion Week for the very first time. We can't wait to see what the star has in star!
title: 6 reasons to be excited for New York Fashion Week
